pkgmetadata.longdescription: This is a relatively simple program to allow user configured tuning of the block I/O schedkulers on linux systems. It allows per-device tuning, as well as tuning for hotplugged devices, and tuning based on certain device parameters. Individuals who use this should make a point to read file:///usr/src/linux/Documentation/block/CFQ-iosched.txt and file:///usr/src/linux/Documentation/block/Deadline-iosched.txt. In general, the most common uses for this script are setting a noop scheduler on SSD's, disabling CFQ's low-latency mode to boost throughput on file servers, and using more sane settings than the default on high-end storage devices (ie. RAID controllers).
